description: Construction of a non-food retail unit (Use Class A1) associated refuse / recycling storage, and re-configuration of car parking spaces and vehicular circulation of car park.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers 0426-05- P180-C, P181-D, P183-E, P184-D, P186-B, P187-C, P188-B, P189-B and 579.19.01 received 31st May 2012, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the building and external areas shall match the appearance of those of the existing development.   REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the host building and the surroundings, in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan 201, policies 4.1 and 7.2  of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies 1.1, 1.2 and 3.1 of Ealing's Development Strategy | The rating noise level emitted from the operation of any plant and machinery as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1 m from the nearest first floor or higher noise sensitive facade. This standard shall be permanently maintained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  REASON:  To safeguard the working/living environment of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policy 7.4 and 7.15 of The London Plan 201,  policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 1.1, 1.2 and 3.1 of Ealing's Development Strategy and the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | The refuse and recycling storage area shown on approved plan no 0426-05-P181-D shall not be used for any other purpose and the storage in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority shall be made fully avaliable before the first occupation of the development hereby approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: To safeguard the working/living environment of neighbouring properties and in the interests of the environment and the street scene, in accordance with policy 7.4 of The London Plan 2011 and policies 2.10 and 4.1 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 1.1, 1.2 and 3.1 of Ealing's Development Strategy and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 4: Refuse and Recycling Facilities. | Areas shown on the approved plans as access, parking (including disabled) and servicing areas shall be completed and marked out on-site prior to first occupation of any part of the development.   REASON: To ensure that suitable access and servicing space is available within the site in the interests of the free flow of traffic and conditions of highway safety, in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan 201, policies 9.1, 9.7 and 9.9 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and  policies 1.1, 1.2 and 3.1 of Ealing's Development Strategy | Notwithstanding any details shown in the application submitted and prior to the first occupation of the development hereby permitted, details for the relocation of the covered cycle parking spaces shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. Such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation, and retained for the lifetime of the development.  REASON: To provide facilities for cyclists that are appropriately overlooked in accordance with policy 6.9 and 7.3 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 4.4 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004. | The development hereby approved shall be fully accessible for people with disabilities.  REASON: To ensure adequate provision for people with disabilities, in accordance with policy 7.2 of The London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1 and 4.3 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 1.1, 1.2 and 3.1 of Ealing's Development Strategy and Supplementary Planning Guidance 07 'Accessible Ealing'. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Class A1 of the schedule of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 2005, or in any provision equivalent to that class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification) the development hereby approved, unit 15 (GIA 965sqm) hereby approved shall only be used as described in the application and for no other purpose.  REASON: To accord with the terms of the application and to protect the vitality and viability of the retail park, in accordance with policies 2.15, 2.16, 4.1, 4.7 and 4.8 of The London Plan 201,  policy 7.2 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for Environment' (2004) and policies 1.1, 1.2, 3.1, 3.6 of Ealing's Development Strategy. | A Green Travel Plan designed to manage the transport needs of staff and customers of retail unit hereby approved, including measures to minimise car useage, promote alternative modes of transport and to manage onsite parking demand in peak periods to ensure safety of users of the parking area, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority before the first occupation of the development, and the approved green travel plan shall be implemented and complied with he approved document.   REASON: To promote sustainable patterns of transport to safeguard the living and working conditions of local people and in the interest of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with section 4 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1, 9.1 and 9.11 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies 1.1, 1.2, 3.1, 3.6 of Ealing's Development Strategy and Supplementary Planning Guidance 21 - Sustainable Transport: Green Travel Plans. | No development shall take place until details of a site construction method statement/management plan has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The method statement/management plan shall include but not limited to the following: "	Phasing and programming "	Anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles parking off site (including contractors) and measurements to minimise impacts; "	Delivery times and parking arrangements  "	Vehicle and machinery specifications; "	Dust and vibration suppression measures; "	Wheel washing provisions "	Site security during construction "	On site storage "	Details of any temporary vehicular access including construction vehicle's manoeuvring and turning, including sweep path diagrams for each type of construction vehicle this document identifies, to avoid damage to trees and problems with servicing vehicles customers of retail park and to demonstrate how vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear. "	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from occupiers of neighbouring premises and customers of the retail park.  The approved details shall be implemented, or phasing agreed in writing, prior to the commencement of works on site and thereafter retained for the duration of the works.  REASON:  In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers, users of the neighbouring highway, in accordance with section 4 of the National Planning Policy Framework,  policies 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2011,  policies 4.1, 9.1 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies 1.1, 1.2 and 3.1 of Ealing's Development Strategy. | A servicing management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first use of the development hereby approved. The servicing of the unit shall be implemented and operated only in accordance with the approved details, and the approved arrangements shall be permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.   REASON: In the interests of highway safety, and maintaining adequate servicing capability for adjacent uses all in accordance with policies 6.3,  6.11, 6.12 and 6.13 of The London Plan (2011), policies 4.1, 9.1, 9.9 and 9.10 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and and policies 1.1, 1.2, 3.1 and 3.6 of Ealing's Development Strategy.
